intro: Solenanthus lanatus, commonly known as the silky solenanthus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family, Asteraceae, and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained conditions and is often found in maritime environments. Solenanthus lanatus plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for native pollinators.
